definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Ludwig Wittgenstein says that human body is the best picture of human soul.
sentences.chinese: 维特根斯坦曾说过，人的身体是人的灵魂的最好图画。

sentences.english: Thus formed a kind of state of Wittgenstein's philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 从而也形成了维特根斯坦的哲学样态。

sentences.english: This thesis reconstructs Wittgenstein's argument of ending philosophy in both early and late stage.
sentences.chinese: 本文重构了前后期维特根斯坦终结哲学的论证。

sentences.english: This is where the significance of Wittgenstein's anti-private language argument lies in.
sentences.chinese: 这就是维特根斯坦反私人语言论证的意义之所在。

sentences.english: The understanding, in Wittgenstein's view, is a relatively vague concept.
sentences.chinese: 而理解，在维特根斯坦看来，是一个比较模糊的概念。

sentences.english: Later Wittgenstein's study of language is a kind of ontological reflection.
sentences.chinese: 后期维特根斯坦则是在一种本体论意义上研究语言。

sentences.english: In Wittgenstein's works, there is not a single work which does not mention Descartes.
sentences.chinese: 维特根斯坦在其著述中，没有一处提到过笛卡儿。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
surname Althusser/Louis Pierre Althusser 路易·皮埃爾·阿爾都塞|路易·皮埃尔·阿尔都塞[Lu4 yi4 · Pi2 ai1 er3 · A1 er3 dou1 sai1] (1918-1990), Marxist philosopher
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
